metadata.name: RDS Database Security Group Modification
metadata.comment: Detects changes to the security group entries for RDS databases. This can indicate that a misconfiguration has occurred which potentially exposes the database to the public internet, a wider audience within the VPC or that removal of valid rules has occurred which could impact the availability of the database to legitimate services and users.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('rds.amazonaws.com') AND (lower(LOWER(metadata.event_code)) in ('authorizedbsecuritygroupingress', 'createdbsecuritygroup', 'deletedbsecuritygroup', 'revokedbsecuritygroupingress')))

output.summary: Detects changes to the security group entries for RDS databases. This can indicate that a misconfiguration has occurred which potentially exposes the database to the public internet, a wider audience within the VPC or that removal of valid rules has occurred which could impact the availability of the database to legitimate services and users.

metadata.objective: False positive: Creation of a new Database that needs new security group rules Reference: https://www.gorillastack.com/blog/real-time-events/important-aws-cloudtrail-security-events-tracking/
